newsitem.title: RUSSIA: Russian govt to consider 97 draft budget Thursday.
newsitem.headline: Russian govt to consider 97 draft budget Thursday.

text.p: The Russian government will consider a new 1997 draft budget at a cabinet meeting on Thursday, Finance Minister Alexander Livshits said on Wednesday.
"The (new) draft budget will come to the government today," Livshits told journalists. "We are in for a serious talk at tomorrow's cabinet meeting."
Last week the State Duma lower house rejected the draft 1997 budget and directed the government to produce a new version within 10 days.
Some Duma deputies highlighted what were considered unrealistic revenue forecasts and inadequate provision for social needs.
The draft envisaged spending of 524.34 trillion roubles, revenues of 433.64 trillion and a deficit of 90.70 trillion, or 3.3 percent of GDP.
Duma budget committee head Mikhail Zadornov told Reuters that the Duma would receive the new draft on Thursday evening if the cabinet passed it on Thursday.
The new draft will first be discussed by a conciliation commission of representatives of the Duma, Federation Council upper house and government for 10 days, and then be submitted to the Duma.
Livshits said the new draft budget would provide for more government investment and would have a separate section on financing military reform.
He said that it was possible to change the revenue and expenditure figures, but not the deficit itself.
